text:
MIN-MIN LIANG: My
name is Min-Min Liang.
I'm from Taiwan.

And I'm a Chinese
lecturer at MIT.

And I graduated my
college in Taiwan.

And I came here to
the United States

to get my master's
degree at Harvard.

And after the master program,
I went to UPenn for the Ph.D.

That's where I started
teaching Chinese,

because I have a
scholarship there.

And even though my major
is Chinese literature,

but I find teaching Chinese
is really fun and stimulating.

And my total years of
teaching is 21 years.

And I find it interesting,
because every school
is different.

And so I constantly have
to adapt my strategy

to a different
group of students.
And I find that's very exciting.
It's not things so mundane.
It's so routine.

In that way, there's
a routine there,

but you have to
change up according
to the audience, the group.
